availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Pork house in Louisville, Kentucky. Operated from 1837 to 1891. Owners: Andrew S. White, John Cowan, Caleb Gutherie, Michael Wolf, James S. White, Samuel P. Weisiger, William Hughes, John D. Taggart, George W. Tarleton. Operated as Hughes, Goslee & Co. from 1868 to 1874 and Hughes, Taggart, & Co. from 1875 to 1891.

ab.bibl:
Jeremiah Hughes, ed., Niles’ National Register, Containing Historical, Geographical, Scientifical, Statistical, Economical, and Biographical Documents, Essays and Facts, vol. 60 (Baltimore: Jeremiah Hughes, 1841), 149.
“Closing Their Ledgers: Members of Hughes, Taggart, & Co. to Retire from Business,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), September 26, 1891, p. 16.
Henry Tanner, ed., Tanner’s Louisville Directory and Business Advertiser for 1861 (Louisville: Directory Publication and Advertising Agency, 1861), 262.
